definition: to change one's mind/to go back on one's word
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
divinatory diagram/one of the eight divinatory trigrams of the Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]/one of the sixty-four divinatory hexagrams of the Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]

sentences.english: A tentative agreement struck on Thursday evaporated after a revolt by House Republicans.
sentences.chinese: 周四，由于共和党变卦，一份临时协议被撤销。

sentences.english: If he backs out of the deal, you can sue him.
sentences.chinese: 他如果变卦取消交易，你就起诉他。

sentences.english: Did your goals change in midstream ?
sentences.chinese: 您的目标有没有中途变卦？

sentences.english: You promised you would help, so you can't back out of it now.
sentences.chinese: 你答应过要帮我的，所以你现在不能变卦。

definition: to renege/to go back (on a deal)/to back out (of a promise)
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
to break a promise/breach of contract
lit. Cheng Yaojin ambushes the enemy (saying)/fig. sb shows up unexpectedly and disrupts the plan/sb whose presence is regarded as irksome
pinyin: ban4 lu4 sha1 chu1 ge4 Cheng2 Yao3 jin1

definition: to fall out with sb and become hostile
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
to break a promise of marriage
the cooked duck flew away (proverb)/(fig.) to let a sure thing slip through one's fingers
pinyin: zhu3 shu2 de5 ya1 zi5 fei1 le5

definition: to have a falling out/to have a big argument
lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
to fizzle out/to come to nothing
to renege/to go back (on a deal)/to back out (of a promise)
to use all sorts of excuses
(coll.) to quit one's job in disgust
the chicken has flown the coop and the eggs are broken/a dead loss (idiom)
